ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class taught me to never judge a book by its cover, and gave me a greater appreciation for many African cultures.
I have a newfound confidence and appreciation for trying things outside of my comfort zone. This may very well be one of my favourite classes I have ever taken. I enjoyed it so so much.
Many skills about African dance
I learned a lot about traditional African dances and rhythms. I learned how to connect my body to different rhythms and let the rhythms guide my movements.

Understanding of rhythm and moveemnt
Learning about African cultures
Immersion in African cultures via dance
rhythm, group work, dancing
learned more about dance in West Africa and across African diasporas.
I developed confidence and comfort with dance and rhythm in my own body.

I learned so much about traditional West African dance, African history, the cultural of rhythm, the concept of riffing, and the vast array of different musical and rhythmic  identities across the continent.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I loved this class.
Really engaging class because of the movement aspect
Strengths: Most of the class is just dancing. Getting to move our bodies for almost all of the class time was so fun and a great contrast to traditional classes. This class is just so fun.

Strengths: Cool material, great guest lecturers, suited for all dance levels
Weaknesses: N/A
It was a lot of fun. There were no weaknesses
No weaknesses of the overall course structure, just weaknesses on the Professors organizational skills. Overall a fun and low commitment course that helps you get your mind off things.

A strength of the course is the flexibility and accommodations this course provides to all students with all different backgrounds with dance. A weakness is the lack of communication that was provided regarding assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! First year students should try to take this course! I gained so many new friends and had such a great time.
1000% yes, I might tell every first-year I see to register for this seminar.
Yes, very fun
Yes. I would recommend this course to everyone. It is so so fun.
Yes-- cool class and something you don't have easy access to in other academic times
I would 100 percent recommend it
Yes, but only if you are okay with getting a very surface level understanding of dance and doing little work.
Yes! This was a fun and lighthearted first year seminar that was perfect for someone event without a dance background.
YES! Such a fun and fulfilling class with little to no outside of class work
Absolutely, I strongly recommend this course to dancers and non-dancers alike.
Yes, it is an enjoyable course that exercises both the mind and the body at the same time.
